Focus on following the recommendations of the health professionals around you.

Focus on doing your JOB.

Here’s an idea: 

Focus on getting our hospitals respirators.

Focus on taking central command of resources so states don’t have to bid against each other for supplies.

Having people confined in close quarters becomes a breeding ground for the virus. We must do everything we can to combat this spread. 6/6
Those who are in jail because they can not afford bail and are not a flight risk should be released from prison as well. 5/
Resources should be given to organizations that work with the formerly incarcerated to ensure these individuals actually have a place to go so that we are not increasing the homeless population. 4/

Those who test positive should be isolated and treated. 

Those who test negative and are senior citizens, pregnant women, or children who are not convicted of violent crimes should be released in a secure manner. 3/
Every single person in federal prison - employees and incarcerated individuals - should be tested immediately. 2/

Failing to take drastic measures to combat the spread of this disease in prison will result in a magnified impact on ALL of society. 1/

Instead of the intelligence and expertise of South Korea, Donald Trump is emulating the sycophancy, incompetence and propaganda of North Korea. 
https://t.co/Lf7c4a4sVD

South Korea has tested more than 230,000 cases with a population of about 50 million. 

To be on track with South Korea, we would have needed to test about 1.5 million people. 

We’ve conducted less than 20,000 tests.

Foster youth will be disproportionately affected if there isn’t.

The resolution I introduced on this issue was JUST passed, which means it is now the sense of the entire House of Representatives to encourage reunions of divided Korean American families. Never let someone tell you that your voice does not matter. 2/2

Last year, I met with Kyung Joo Lee, a 90-year-old Korean American who has not seen four of his siblings since he fled North Korea more than 70 years ago. He cried as he held my hands and urged me to do what I can to help Korean families to be reunited. 1/ https://t.co/E2gcpcldUw
RT @NAACP: “The groundbreaking achievements of Black women in America are proof that there is power in collective movements” - @RepKarenBas…

Increase the capacity of our medical system — we must use our emergency response mechanisms to mobilize resources and facilities in order to respond to surges in demand.

It's time to act. 9/9
Anti-price gouging protections — we must ensure that Americans are protected from price gouging of medical and non-medical essentials during this emergency 8/

Affordable treatment for all — patients must be reimbursed for any non-covered coronavirus-related costs, or else the epidemic will be worsened because Americans will fear they cannot afford the costs associated with treatment 7/

Widespread and free coronavirus testing — the administration must ensure that all Americans who need an evaluation are able to access locations for cost-free testing and rapidly increase the unacceptably low daily test processing capacity inside the U.S. 6/

Clear protections for frontline workers — we must have clear standards & sufficient distribution of necessary protective equipment for health care & other workers who are in contact with people who have been exposed as well as the people who clean those facilities 5/

Food security — we must expand SNAP, WIC, school lunch and other initiatives and suspend implementation of any regulations that weaken federal food assistance, in order to ensure vulnerable populations do not lose access to food during this epidemic 4/
Enhanced Unemployment Insurance — we must ensure unemployment insurance benefits are available and sufficient for workers who may lose their jobs from the economic impacts of the epidemic 3/

Paid sick leave — workers impacted by quarantine orders or responsible for caring for children impacted by school closures must receive paid sick leave to alleviate the devastating consequences of lost wages. 2/

[THREAD]: In the midst of this outbreak, the administration must prioritize the health and safety of American workers and their families over corporate interests. 

Here's how: 1/
If we want to stop the spread of this disease, there needs to be paid sick leave and free testing. Period. https://t.co/8h8k3VRwzJ

This will add to the trauma already experienced by the child but also data shows that cases become unreasonably and unacceptably unfair when they take place by video. 

The Department of Justice must suspend this attempt to further traumatize children in its care. 3/3

My office just got word that in 3 days, the Department of Justice will begin piloting this technique for immigrant children detained in Houston. Instead of being in the same courtroom as the judge, they will see their judge, who will be 800 miles away in Atlanta, on a screen. 2/

Imagine you’re an 8 year old child in a country you’ve never been to hundreds of miles from a home you will never see again and you’re walked into a courtroom with zero people in it. 

All that’s there is a TV screen showing you a judge, an ICE attorney and your interpreter. 1/
